result.execSummary:
All charges against Zacharyah M. Yerken in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zacharyah M. Yerken is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zacharyah M. Yerken

records.addlTxt: Clerk's cover letter and check returned/unable to forward and no mail receptacle
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:34 PM Defendant Zacharyah M. Yerken in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews history of case. Court has denied court appointed atty. Def. will represent himself. Court goes over atty rights and finds freely & voluntarily given. Def. enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives Not Guilty plea. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

records.addlTxt: 03:36 PM Defendant Zacharyah M. Yerken in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews history of case. Def. contact P.D. and received court appointed atty for from P.D and def. is not eligible for P.D. Def. needs to turn form into COC.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

04:07 PM Defendant Zacharyah M. Yerken in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom. CC gives atty rights to def. Def. is going to reach out to P.D.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bond Posting Information from City of Neenah
Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

01:14 PM Defendant Zacharyah M. Yerken in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Zacharyah M. Yerken appeared by video means. All appearances are by Zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. makes statement as to counsel, directed to contact PD. State heard on bond, recommends $250 cash with conditions maintain absolute sobriety and no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Def. heard on bond. The Court orders $150 cash bond with conditions maintain absolute sobriety,  no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
